summary: A tip forwarded from the National Human Trafficking Hotline to the FBI alleges that Jeffrey Epstein, accompanied by two young Eastern European girls, attended an Arizona State University workshop in February 2017. The tipster describes inappropriate behavior by Epstein at the event and notes prior invitations to ASU events. The report was submitted for law enforcement follow-up.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the trafficker who attended an ASU workshop in February 2017 with two young Eastern European girls, allegedly behaving inappropriately. He is noted as a major donor to the Origins Project.

persons.name: Lawrence Krauss
persons.context: Invited Jeffrey Epstein to the Origins Project workshop on Artificial Intelligence at Arizona State University. Mentioned in relation to a Title IX investigation at ASU in summer 2018.

persons.name: Noam Chomsky
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a talk at Gammage auditorium on March 22, 2015, which Epstein attended with a young woman.

connections.description: Krauss invited Epstein to an ASU Origins Project workshop as a major donor to the project.

events.title: ASU Origins Project Workshop
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attended the Arizona State University Origins Project Workshop on Artificial Intelligence at the Tempe Mission Palms Hotel. He appeared at breakfast in a robe with two young Eastern European girls who were stroking him.

events.title: Noam Chomsky Talk at ASU
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attended a Noam Chomsky talk at Gammage auditorium, to which he was invited to a students-only pizza party and brought a young woman.

events.title: ASU Title IX Investigation
events.description: A Title IX investigation was conducted at Arizona State University into Lawrence Krauss during the summer of 2018, during which complaints about Epstein's behavior at the 2017 workshop were reportedly made but not addressed.

locations: Tempe Mission Palms Hotel, Tempe, Arizona
6100 Red Hook Quarters, Suite B3, St. Thomas, VI 00802-1348
keyFacts: A tip alleges Jeffrey Epstein attended an ASU workshop in February 2017 with two young Eastern European girls who appeared to be 15-16 years old, and he was seen in a robe with them at breakfast.
Lawrence Krauss invited Epstein to the workshop as a major donor to the Origins Project.
Complaints about Epstein's behavior were reportedly made during a Title IX investigation into Krauss at ASU in summer 2018 but were not addressed.
Epstein had previously been invited to an ASU students-only pizza party for a Noam Chomsky talk in March 2015, where he also brought a young woman.
The tipster believes ASU has records of the 2017 event, including a sign-in sheet with the girls' names and signatures, and that attendees may have photos.
